introduction.title: Introduction to Knowledge Graphs
introduction.content: This page introduces the concept of knowledge graphs and how they can be used to represent interconnected information.

basics.title: Graph Theory Basics
basics.content: Understanding the fundamental concepts of graph theory including nodes, edges, and graph properties.

visualization.title: Data Visualization Techniques
visualization.content: Exploring various techniques for visualizing complex data structures and relationships.

d3-overview.title: D3.js Force Simulation
d3-overview.content: Deep dive into D3.js force simulation for creating dynamic, physics-based graph layouts.

algorithms.title: Graph Algorithms
algorithms.content: Common algorithms used in graph traversal and analysis including BFS, DFS, and shortest path.

data-structures.title: Graph Data Structures
data-structures.content: Different ways to represent graphs in code: adjacency lists, adjacency matrices, and edge lists.

force-layouts.title: Force-Directed Layouts
force-layouts.content: How force-directed algorithms create aesthetically pleasing graph layouts through physics simulation.

pixi-rendering.title: Pixi.js Canvas Rendering
pixi-rendering.content: Using Pixi.js for high-performance 2D rendering with WebGL and Canvas fallback.

bfs-search.title: Breadth-First Search
bfs-search.content: Implementing and understanding breadth-first search for graph traversal and shortest path finding.

webgl-performance.title: WebGL Performance Optimization
webgl-performance.content: Techniques for optimizing WebGL rendering performance in browser-based graphics applications.
